page.title: 06HORSINGTON GRANGE FARM
page.content:
The different chemicals used on the farm for killing weeds and helping the crops to grow are: nitrogen; phosphate; potassium; calcium.
The farm's biggest field has an area of 350 acres, or 140 hectares. The busiest times of year on the farm are during August and September, for the harvest, September and October, when the farm is seed drilling, and in March, April, May and June during the fertiliser / agrochemical application period.
There are no animals reared on the farm. Much of the farm's land is outside our area.
